alert.note: Alert for Atoka; Coal (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 11 at 5:46PM CDT until April 11 at 6:30PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Coal County in southeastern Oklahoma... Northeastern Atoka County in southeastern Oklahoma... * Until 630 PM CDT. * At 546 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 4 miles northwest of Lehigh, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Coalgate, Stringtown, Lehigh, Wardville, Daisy, Olney, Phillips, Atoka Reservoir, Redden, Chockie and northern McGee Creek Lake. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
